item.title: MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading diagnostic, also known as a screener, to all students in kindergarten through third grade each year to measure whether a student is on track.

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
This study seeks to elevate the voices of parents and teachers to better discern their points of view about assessments in Texas today as they work together to drive better

The post 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
This study seeks to elevate the voices of parents and teachers to better discern their points of view about assessments in Texas today as they work together to drive better learning for every student in their state.

The post 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Evaluating The Effect Of Random Selection On MAP Similar Schools Insights Creation
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
This study evaluated the procedures for selecting students to be used as virtual comparisons in an effort to determine whether the random selection procedures created differences between the similar schools

The post Evaluating The Effect Of Random Selection On MAP Similar Schools Insights Creation appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
This study evaluated the procedures for selecting students to be used as virtual comparisons in an effort to determine whether the random selection procedures created differences between the similar schools in the comparison group sample and the population from which it was drawn.

The post Evaluating The Effect Of Random Selection On MAP Similar Schools Insights Creation appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Make Assessment Work for All Students: Multiple Measures Matter
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
Read Make Assessment Work for All Students: Multiple Measures Matter, the 2016 national survey conducted by NWEA and Gallup, to learn what students, parents, and educators really think about assessment. With

The post Make Assessment Work for All Students: Multiple Measures Matter appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Read Make Assessment Work for All Students: Multiple Measures Matter, the 2016 national survey conducted by NWEA and Gallup, to learn what students, parents, and educators really think about assessment. With the study results and the recent passage of the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA), leaders and educators have an opportunity to rethink our assessment systems so that they work best for our students and teachers. This is the 3rd National Assessment Perception study.

The post Make Assessment Work for All Students: Multiple Measures Matter appeared first on NWEA.
